content: Department of Chemistry and Chemical Biology, Rutgers-The State Uni Versity of New Jersey, Piscataway,New Jersey 08854Received January 31, 2008; E-mail: warmuth@rutgers.eduSpherical molecules, whose shapes and symmetries parallel thoseof the regular or semiregular, convex polyhedra, also known asPlatonic and Archimedian solids, are attractive synthetic targets andhave the potential to encapsulate one or more guest molecules.

Department of Chemistry and Chemical Biology , Rutgers-The State University of New Jersey, Piscataway, NJ 08854, USA E-mail: warmuth@rutgers.edu     1. Experimental procedures  General : Reagents and chromatography solvents were purchased from Aldrich and used without further purifi cation except that chloroform was passed through K 2CO 3 prior to use. THF was dried and degased using a Solv Tech solvent purification system. 1H NMR spectra recorded in CDCl 3 and CD 2Cl2 were referenced to residual CHCl 3 and CHDCl 2 at 7.26 and 5.30 ppm. 13C NMR spectra recorded in CDCl 3 were referenced to 13CDCl 3 at 77.0 ppm. Mass spectra were reco rded on an Applied Biosystems Voyager DE-Pro mass spectrometer (MALDI-TOF). 2, 4,6-Trihydroxylacetophenone (THAP) was used as matrix. For compounds 6 and 9, Ag(O 2CCF 3) was added to the matrix. Gel permeation chromatography (GPC) was performed on a Thermo SpectraSYSTEM HPLC system equipped with dual wavelength  UV/Vis detector (280 nm), Eppendorf CH-30 column heater and two Jordi GPC columns (cross linked DVB; 103 ? pore size; MW cutoff ~ 25,000; 7.8mm ¡Á 30cm) with CH 2Cl2/1% NEt 3 as mobile phase at a flow of 1 mL/min. Approximate molecular weights of  analytes were determined from a semi logarithmic calibration plot (Ln(MW) agai nst retention time) using the following molecular weight standards : benzene (MW 78); cavitand 2 (MW 1075); a NMP hemicarceplex (MW 2348) [1],  and three polyaminonanocaps ules (MW 3941, 5912 and 7882) [2,3].

When ( P)-2(>99% ee) and 3awere mixed in a 8:12 ratio inCHCl 3containing 1 mol% TFA, homochiral nanocube ( all-P )-1aformed in ¡«90% yield together with ¡«10% of diastereomericheterochiral cubes containing ( M)-2(Figure S41). The latter cubesresult from partial inversion of ( P)-2during the reaction.

S2   1.1. C3-Triiodo-trihexadecyloxycyclotribenzylene 9  C3-Triiodocyclotriphenolene 11 (0.99 g, 1.4 mmol) [4], pota ssium carbonate (3.5 g, 25.4 mmol), and 1-bromohexadecane (3.6 mL, 11.8 mm ol) were suspended in dry DMF (21 mL).  After stirred at 95 oC under argon for two days, the reaction mixture was poured into HCl (1 M, 30 mL), followed by extrac tion with dichlorometha ne (3 x 20 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with brine (20 mL) and sodium bicarbonate solution (25 mL). The solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The residual crude product was purified by column chromatogr aphy (silica gel, hexane/dichloromethane 4:1). Yield: 1.1 g (57.3%). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH:  7.69 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 6.69 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 4.51 (d, 3H, 2J (Ha,He) = 13.6 Hz; Ha), 3.99 (m, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 3.48 (d, 3H,  2J (Ha,He) = 13.6 Hz; He), 1.80 (m, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3 ), 1.49 (m, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 1.43-1.00 (b, 72H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 0.90 (t, 9H, OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄC: 156.9, 140.9, 140.6, 133. 0, 113.6, 85.1, 69.7, 36. 2, 32.2, 30.00, 29.98, 29.95, 29.91, 29.89, 29.65, 29.61, 29.27, 26.3, 23.0, 14.4. MALDI-TOF mass: m/z: 1475.40 ([M+Ag]+, 1475.47 (calcd.))  1.2.  C3-Triformyl-trihexadecyloxycyclotribenzylene rac-2   C3-Triiodo-trihexadecyloxycyclotribenzylene 9 (500 mg, 0.37 mmol) was dissolved in dry THF (16.5 mL) under Argon. The solution was cooled to -78 oC. n-BuLi (1.65 mL, 2.5 M in hexanes) was added via syri nge. After stirred at 78 oC for 10min, the solution was warmed to 0 oC, and stirred at that temperature for 1h. Dry DMF (1.65 mL, 21.3 mmol) was added via syringe, and the so lution was stirred at room temperature for 2 h. The reaction was quenched by adding saturated NH 4Cl(aq) (10 mL). THF was removed under reduced pressure. The resulting mixtur e was extracted three times with CH 2Cl2 (3 x 20 mL). The combined organic layers were wa shed with water (3 x 15 mL). The organic layer was concentrated to dryness under re duced pressure. The residual crude product was purified by column chromatography (sili ca gel, hexanes/EtOAc = 7:1).Yield: 345 mg S3  (0.32 mmol, 88%). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH: 10.35 (s, 3H; C HO), 7.82 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 6.98 (s, 3H; aryl- H)  4.73 (d, 3H, 2J (Ha,He) = 14.2 Hz; Ha), 4.05 (m, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 3.76 (d, 3H,  2J (Ha,He) = 14.2 Hz; He), 1.79 (m, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3 ), 1.46 (b, 6H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 1.37-1.22 (b, 72H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 0.88 (t, 9H, OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄC: 189.5, 160.8, 148.2, 130. 4, 129.8, 124.2, 114. 2, 69.1, 37.0, 32.2, 29.99, 29.98, 29.96, 29. 95, 29.87, 29.84, 29. 65, 29.63, 29.3, 26.3,  23.6, 14.4. MALDI-TOF mass: m/z: 1098.57 ([M+Na]+, 1097.85 (calcd.)) Elemental analysis: found: 10.94 (%H), 80.04 (%C); calcd: 10.68 (%H), 80.39 (%C).

1.3.  C3-Triformylcyclotrianisylene rac-6  n-BuLi (1.79 mL, 2.5 M in hexanes) was added to dry THF (23 mL) at -78 oC under Argon and the solution was stirred at this temperature for 10min. This solution was cannulated into a flask charged with C3-triiodocyclotrianisylene 12 [4] (425 mg, 0.58 mmol) at -78 oC. After stirring for 50 min at -78 oC, dry DMF (1.79 mL, 23.1 mmol) was added and the mixture was furthe r stirred 20 min at -78 oC and 1 h at room  temperature.

The reaction was quenched by adding excess saturated NH 4Cl(aq). THF was removed under reduced pressure and the resulting mixt ure was filtered. Th e precipitate was washed with CH 2Cl2 (30 mL). The crude product was purified by column chromatography (silica gel, CH 2Cl2/EtOAc  20:1). Yield: 160  mg (0.32 mmol, 63%).1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH: 10.33 (s, 3H; C HO), 7.85 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 7.00 (s, 3H; aryl-H)  4.78 (d, 3H, 2J (Ha,He) = 13.5 Hz; Ha), 3.91 (s, 9H; O CH 3), 3.80 (d, 3H,  2J (Ha,He) = 13.5 Hz; He). MALDI-TOF mass: m/z: 551.01 ([M+Ag]+, 551.06 (calcd.)).

1.4.  Cryptophane ( P,P,R,R,R )-4  R = hexadecylORN N RORONNN ROROORNPP(P,P,R,R,R )-4HeHa S4  CTV rac- 2 (13.4 mg, 0.0125 mmol), (1 R,2R)-(?)-1,2-diaminocyclohexan e (2.8 mg, 0.025 mmol, 99% ee), trifluoroacetic acid (TFA) (1% in CHCl 3, 8.6 ¦ÌL), and a few beads of 4 ? molecular sieves were mixed in CHCl 3 (5.6 mL) in an air-tight vessel. The mixture was stirred at 80 oC overnight. After cooling to room temperature, potassium carbonate (15 mg) was added. This suspension was sonicat ed and subsequently filt ered. The filtrate was concentrated and excess hexanes were added.  The precipitate was isolated by filtration and dried under high vacuum. Yield: 12.9 mg (0.005 mmol, 92%). 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH: 8.37 (s, 6H; C HN), 7.72 (s, 6H; aryl- H), 6.83 (s, 6H; aryl- H)  4.54 (d, 6H, 2J (Ha,He) = 13.3 Hz; Ha), 4.05 (m, 12H; O CH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 3.56 (d, 3H,  2J (Ha,He) = 13.3 Hz; He ), 3.01 (m, 6H; NC H), 1.83 (b, 18H,), 1.69 (b, 12H), 1.54-1.21 (b, 162H), 0.88 (t, 18H, OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄC: 157.3, 155.1, 143.4, 130. 4, 128.2, 123.9, 114.3, 75.6, 69.4, 36.4, 34.3, 32.2, 30.23, 30.11, 30.053, 30.047, 30.040, 30.033, 30. 027, 29.989, 29.978, 29.67, 29.37, 26.5, 25.6, 23.0, 14.4. MALDI-TOF mass: m/z: 2384.98 ([M+H]+, 2385.01 (calcd.)).

1.5.  Cryptophane ( P,P,R,R,R )-10 R=C H 3ORN N RORONNN ROROORNPP(P,P,R,R,R )-10HeHa CTV rac-6 (7.2 mg, 0.016 mmol), (1 R,2R)-(?)-1,2-diaminocyclohexane (3.3 mg, 0.029 mmol, 99% ee), TFA (1% in CHCl 3, 11.1 ¦ÌL), and a few beads of 4 ? molecular sieves were mixed in CHCl 3 (7.2 mL) in an air-tight vessel.  The mixture was stirred at 80 oC overnight. After cooling to room temperat ure, potassium carbonat e (15 mg) was added.

S5  1.6.  ( P)-C3-Triformyl-trihexadecyloxycyclotribenzylene ( P)-2 Cryptophane ( P,P,R,R,R )-4 (8.14 mg, 0.0034 mmol), TFA (852 ¦ÌL) were dissolved in THF (9 mL, saturated with water). The soluti on was stirred at room  temperature for 2h.

A large amount of brine was added and the product was extracted with CHCl 3 (3 x 10 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with sodium bicarbonate solution (1 M, 10 mL) and brine. The solution was concen trated and excess hexanes were added to precipitate the product. The pr ecipitate was collected the pr oduct by filtration and dried at high vacuum. Yield:  6.6 mg (0.006mmol, 92%, >99% ee).

Cryptophane ( P,P,R,R,R )-10 (4.88 mg, 0.004 mmol) and TFA (236 ¦ÌL) were dissolved in THF (2.6 mL, saturated with water). The so lution was stirred at room temperature for 2 h. A large amount of brine was added to  the reaction mixture. The product was extracted with CHCl 3 (3 x 10 mL). The combined organi c layer was washed with sodium bicarbonate solution (1 M, 10 mL) and brine. The solution was filtered and the solvent removed under reduced pressure to give ( P)-6, which was further dried at high vacuum.

1.8.  ( P)-C3-Cyclotriguaicyclene ( P)-7 [5]  CTV ( P)-6 (3.5 mg, 0.0078 mmol)  and mCPBA (70%, 11.7 mg) were sonicated in CDCl 3 in an NMR tube. The progress of  the reaction was followed by 1H-NMR spectroscopy.

After completion of the reacti on (3 h), the mixture was pour ed into sodium thiosulfate solution (10%, 5 mL) and was extracted with CHCl 3 (3 x 10 mL). The combined organic layers were washed with sodium thiosulfate solution, sodium bicarbonate solution and brine. The solvent was removed and the re sidue was dissolved in THF/MeOH (1/1, 160 ¦ÌL). KOH in MeOH (90 ¦ÌL, 0.11g/mL) was added to  the solution. After stirring at room temperature for 20 min, excess 1M aqueous HCl was added. The mixture was extracted with CHCl 3 (3 x 10 mL). The combined organic la yers were washed with brine and sodium bicarbonate solution (1 M, 5 mL). Pure ( P)-7 was obtained after removing the solvent at reduced pressure. Both st eps offered quantitative yields by 1H NMR. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH [5]: 6.88 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 6.78 (s, 3H; aryl- H), 5.38 (s, 3H; OH) 4.71 (d, 6H, 2J (Ha,He) = 14.2 Hz; Ha), 3.85 (s, 9H; O CH 3), 3.50 (d, 3H,  2J (Ha,He) = 14.2 Hz; He).

S6  1.9.  Synthesis of ( all-P )-1a CTV ( P)-2 (6.8 mg, 0.0063 mmol, >99 %ee), 1,4-phenylenediamine 3a (1.1 mg, 0.0099 mmol), TFA (1% in CHCl 3, 8.5 ¦ÌL), and a few beads of 4 ? molecular sieves were mixed in CHCl 3 (2.3 mL). After stirring at room temperature overnight, the reaction was stopped by addition of K 2CO 3 followed by sonication. After removal of solid materials, the solution was concentrated and (all-P)-1a precipitated with hexanes . The precipitated product was collected by filtration and dried under high vacuum. Yield: 7.8 mg (0.00082 mmol, 95%). Rac-1a was prepared by the same procedure in similar yields by using rac-2 instead of ( P)-2.

1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH:  8.82 (s, 24H; C HN), 8.15 (s, 24H; aryl- H), 7.18 (s, 48H; aryl- H), 8.15 (s, 24H; aryl- H), 4.51 (d, 24H, 2J (Ha,He) = 11.8 Hz; Ha), 4.04 (m, 48H; O CH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 3.83 (d, 24H,  2J (Ha,He) = 11.8 Hz; He), 1.77 (sb, 48H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3 ), 1.41 (sb, 48H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 1.43-1.00 (m, 566H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 0.76 (t, 72H, OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄC: 158.2, 155.4, 150.7, 145.0, 131.2, 128.8, 124. 0, 122.0, 113.8, 68.9,  36.8, 32.1, 30.00, 29.95, 29.93, 29.91, 29.87, 29.83, 29.57, 29.53, 29.31, 26.4, 22.9, 14.3.  MALDI-TOF mass: m/z: 9470.9 ([M+H]+, 9471.7 (calcd.))  1.10. Synthesis of ( all-P )-1b CTV ( P)-2 (6.6 mg, 0.0061 mmol, >99 %ee) and benzidine 3b (1.7 mg, 0.0092 mmol), TFA (1% in CDCl3, 5.3 ¦ÌL), and a few beads of  4 ? molecular sieves were mixed in CDCl 3 in an NMR tube. The progress of  the reaction was followed by 1H NMR spectroscopy. The reaction was completed after leaving it overnight at room temperature. The catalyst was removed by adding solid K 2CO 3 followed by sonication.

After removal of solid materials,  the solution was concentrated and ( all-P)-1b precipitated with hexanes. The precipitated product was colle cted by filtration and dried at high vacuum. Yield: 6. 6 mg (0.00064 mmol, 84%). Rac-1b was prepared by the same procedure in yields by using rac-2 instead of ( P)-2. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄH:  8.85 (s, 24H; C HN), 8.21 (s, 24H; aryl- H), 7.61 (d, 48H, 2J (H, H) = 7.9 Hz; aryl- H), 7.24 (d, 48H, 2J (H, H) = 7.9 Hz; aryl- H), 7.09 (s, 24H; aryl- H), 4.83 (d, 24H, 2J (Ha,He) = 12.0 Hz; Ha), 3.95 (m, 48H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 3.85 (d, 24H,  2J (Ha,He) = 12.0 Hz; He), 1.79 (sb, 48H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 1.42 (sb, 48H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 1.35-1.13 (m, 566H; OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3), 0.78 (t, 72H, OCH 2CH 2CH 2(CH 2)12CH 3). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl 3, 25 oC) ¦ÄC: 158.3, 156.1, 152.3, 145.2, 138.3,  131.2, 130.0, 127. 7, 124.0, 121.8, HaHeH3C(CH2)15O NHHaHeH3C(CH2)15O NHS7  113.9, 69.0, 36.8, 32.2, 29. 99, 29.973, 29.965, 29.959, 29. 91, 29.89, 29.87, 29.61, 29.35, 26.4, 22.9, 14.3. Chiral HPLC Chiral HPLC was performed on an Agilent  1200 HPLC system equi pped with an Astec Cyclobond I 2000Ac column (4.6mm ¡Á 25 cm) with hexanes (99.4% )/isopropanol (0.6%) as mobile phase at a flow rate  of 1.0 ml/min. Detection at ¦Ë = 264 nm.
